channel.title: Help with ReplaceObject
channel.description:
What this is supposed to do is just put a newer better wall over a 'permanent' one.
so really the title says it..
I'm trying to get a ReplaceObject to work.. heres an example of what it is..
[code] ReplaceObject(3263, 3097, 1585, 0);//wall ReplaceObject(3263, 3096, 1585, 0);//wall ReplaceObject(3263, 3095, 1585, 0);//wall ReplaceObject(3263, 3094, 1585, 0);//wall ReplaceObject(3263, 3093, 1585, 0);//wall ReplaceObject(3263, 3093, 1585, -3);//wall ReplaceObject(3264, 3093, 1585, -3);//wall ReplaceObject(3265, 3093, 1585, -3);//wall ReplaceObject(3266, 3093, 1585, -3);//wall ReplaceObject(3267, 3093, 1585, -3);//wall ReplaceObject(3268, 3093, 1585, -3);//wall ReplaceObject(3269, 3093, 1585, -3);//wall ReplaceObject(3270, 3093, 1585, -3);//wall ReplaceObject(3271, 3093, 1585, -3);//wall[/code] thats just a little bit.. but it compiles fine it just doesn't REPLACE it..
Anything I might need to add? or a specific place to add.. :confused:EDIT: i know someone has an answer :P

item.title: Help with ReplaceObject
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

[code] public void createGlobalObject(int j, int k, int l, int i1, int j1)
{
outStream.createFrame(85);
outStream.writeByteC(k - mapRegionY * 8);
outStream.writeByteC(j - mapRegionX * 8);
outStream.createFrame(101);
outStream.writeByteC((j1 << 2) + (i1 & 3));
outStream.writeByte(0);
if(l != -1)
{
outStream.createFrame(151);
outStream.writeByteS(0);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian(l);
outStream.writeByteS((j1 << 2) + (i1 & 3));
}
}

public void createObject(int j, int k, int l, int i1, int j1)

{
PlayerHandler _tmp = server.playerHandler;
Player aplayer[] = PlayerHandler.players;
int k1 = aplayer.length;
for(int l1 = 0; l1 < k1; l1++)
{
Player player = aplayer[l1];
if(player == null) {
continue;
}
client client1 = (client)player;
if((client1.playerName != null || client1.playerName != “null”) && client1.distanceToPoint(j, k) <= 60)
{
client1.createGlobalObject(j, k, l, i1, j1);
}
}
}[/code]

j = objectX, k = objectY, l = New objects id, i1 = direction object is facing, j1 = Type of object.

Read full topic

What this is supposed to do is just put a newer better wall over a ‘permanent’ one.

Anything I might need to add? or a specific place to add… EDIT: i know someone has an answer
